intro: Hieracium pseudobaldense, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cooler climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Hieracium pseudobaldense is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
